title: Anthony Kiedis: The RHCP Album Cover That Came To John Frusciante In His Dream [News]
text:
Posted 3 hours ago 4 
Anthony Kiedis and Chad Smith discussed RHCP album covers, revealing how " Californication " artwork came to John Frusciante in his dream. 
Anthony said on the Woody Show (via Alternative Nation ): "We had a cover that came to Frusciante in a dream, 'Californication.' That was his dream, that the sky, and the way the water [looked the way it did]." 
The singer further noted: "As far as the album covers, we all chip in, in one way or another. 
"I can tell you that the ' Mother's Milk ' cover was directly inspired by a Sly and the Family Stone poster. I was in love with Sly in the '80s, and he had a poster where he was standing large and holding his band. 
"I thought, how cool would it be if there was a big beautiful woman holding us? So it was kind of a steal and ode to Sly Stone, that particular cover." 
Chad chimed in: "Flea saw it somewhere, ' The Getaway ' image." 
"Yes, on Tumblr," Anthony responded. "He was like, 'Hey, does anyone know who did this? Because I really like it.'"
